Articles.Content: Hi there, been a while since I've played KSP, loving the 0.9 update so far (or whatever version it is atm idk). The skillset for Kerbonauts is a welcome addition - I was wondering if I took 2 scientists with me on a mission would the science benefits stack? ie. would I get a 200% bonus on science from having 2 scientists onboard? Also, is it worth it to cluster lv-t30s any more or are their better engine solutions out there?

Hello,

I think scientists don't stack. It's just the highest one that counts.

As for the engines, it's just a matter of preference. I personally cluster LV-T45's, skippers, or nukes (depending on the craft). The engine goes all to what you like and need.

It's 0.90, actually. 0.9 was way back...

Scientists? I don't think they stack...

Skills don't stack.

T30s are still lovely within their payload range but Mainsails surpass them quite quickly. T30s remain cheap, if you can cluster them without expensive structural parts just for that reason.

49-7S are at bargin prices; it's a "before the fire" sale.
